intro: Lotononis schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's lotonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
